lead_paragraph: Under the agreement, New Jersey officials would be in charge of reducing the city’s debt of $240 million and making cuts to the size and cost of its civil services.

byline.contributor: Patrick McGeehan reported from Atlantic City, and Marc Santora from New York. Alexander Burns contributed reporting from Manchester, N.H.
byline.original: By PATRICK McGEEHAN and MARC SANTORA

headline.print_headline: Deal to Give State Control Over Atlantic City’s Finances
headline.main: Christie Announces Plan for State Control of Atlantic City’s Finances

snippet: Under the agreement, New Jersey officials would be in charge of reducing the city’s debt of $240 million and making cuts to the size and cost of its civil services.
abstract: New Jersey Gov Chris Christie announces agreement has been reached with Atlantic City officials in which state will take control of city's finances in bid to save it from bankruptcy; agreement stops short of full takeover of city's government.
